there's a lot of problems with doing computational networks if they get to a certain scale certain types of
complexity so what we want to do is be able to take the relevant Parts bring it close to the

here there's a small graph and this is out of some of the larger talks this is

and it's very apparent however if you take that same data and represent it
in a normalized form for a relational database you get something like this you'd end up with like six tables and
you've got your your primary keys and your foreign Keys you've got your ERD diagram but the thing is it's just
atomized to the point where if if an expert in medieval Villages looked at
